vision.notes: Adults are known to fly at dusk or after dark, suggesting visual capabilities for navigation and prey/mate detection. Larvae likely have some visual sensitivity, though primarily rely on mechanosensation.

mechanosensation.notes: Larvae are highly sensitive to vibrations in the sand to detect prey falling into their pits. Adults may also use mechanosensation for flight and detecting prey/mates.

chemoreception.notes: The role of chemoreception in prey detection or mate location is unknown, but plausible.
